clearViews().Description: Clear the list of Views that have been created by this AppWidgetHost.

createView(android.content.Context,int,a.Description: Create the AppWidgetHostView for the given widget. The AppWidgetHost retains a pointer to the newly-created View.
createView(android.content.Context,int,a.FullName: public final AppWidgetHostView createView (Context context, int appWidgetId, AppWidgetProviderInfo appWidget)

onProvidersChanged().Description: Called when the set of available widgets changes (ie. widget containing packages are added, updated or removed, or widget components are enabled or disabled.)

stopListening().Description: Stop receiving onAppWidgetChanged calls for your AppWidgets. Call this when your activity is no longer visible, i.e. from onStop() in your Activity.

deleteAllHosts().Description: Remove all records about all hosts for your package. Call this when initializing your database, as it might be because of a data wipe. Call this to have the AppWidget manager release all resources associated with your host. Any future calls about this host will cause the records to be re-allocated.

Parameters: Activity: The activity from which to start the configure one. This value must never be null.
int: The bound app widget whose provider's config activity to start.
int: Optional request code retuned with the result.
Bundle: This value may be null.
Throws: If the activity is not found.
startAppWidgetConfigureActivityForResult.Description: Starts an app widget provider configure activity for result on behalf of the caller. Use this method if the provider is in another profile as you are not allowed to start an activity in another profile. You can optionally provide a request code that is returned in @B_android#app#Activity#onActivityResult_E@ and an options bundle to be passed to the started activity. Note that the provided app widget has to be bound for this method to work.
startAppWidgetConfigureActivityForResult.FullName: public final void startAppWidgetConfigureActivityForResult (Activity activity, int appWidgetId, int intentFlags, int requestCode, Bundle options)

startListening().Description: Start receiving onAppWidgetChanged calls for your AppWidgets. Call this when your activity becomes visible, i.e. from onStart() in your Activity.

allocateAppWidgetId().Description: Get a appWidgetId for a host in the calling process.

onCreateView(android.content.Context,int.Description: Called to create the AppWidgetHostView. Override to return a custom subclass if you need it.
onCreateView(android.content.Context,int.FullName: protected AppWidgetHostView onCreateView (Context context, int appWidgetId, AppWidgetProviderInfo appWidget)

deleteHost().Description: Remove all records about this host from the AppWidget manager. Call this when initializing your database, as it might be because of a data wipe. Call this to have the AppWidget manager release all resources associated with your host. Any future calls about this host will cause the records to be re-allocated.

getAppWidgetIds().Description: Gets a list of all the appWidgetIds that are bound to the current host

onProviderChanged(int,android.appwidget..Description: Called when the AppWidget provider for a AppWidget has been upgraded to a new apk.
onProviderChanged(int,android.appwidget..FullName: protected void onProviderChanged (int appWidgetId, AppWidgetProviderInfo appWidget)

deleteAppWidgetId(int).Description: Stop listening to changes for this AppWidget.

ClassDesc: AppWidgetHost provides the interaction with the AppWidget service for apps, like the home screen, that want to embed AppWidgets in their UI.
